other_tests.findings: The esophagus appeared normal. The gastric body also appeared normal; however, the gastric antrum was erythematous, suggesting inflammation. The second part of the duodenum had diffuse, moderate indentations of the circular folds described as moderately scalloped mucosa.
Biopsy specimens of the distal esophagus, gastric antrum, and duodenum were obtained for histopathological examination.
